left.name: program_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.

data.name: program_id
data.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.

left.name: submitter_donor_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

data.name: submitter_donor_id
data.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

left.name: gender
left.description: Description of the donor self-reported gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles.

left.description: Donor's last known state of living or deceased.

left.description: Indicate the cause of a donor's death.

meta.notes: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

left.description: Interval of how long the donor has survived since primary diagnosis, in days.

meta.notes: Survival_time is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

left.name: primary_site
left.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

data.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.
